page.title: 15Nuclear waste at Elstow ?
page.content: The announcement by the Government agency{NIREX}that the Elstow Storage Depot in the east of our area is a site chosen for the burial of{low {level nuclear waste}has caused much local controversy. In defence of the plan NIREX say that the disposal would be perfectly safe, the site having been chosen ongeological grounds. Opponents of the plan known as{BAND - {Bedfordshire}Against Nuclear Dumping, believe that the site is unsuitable as it is so close to residential areas. They point out that the transportation of the waste to the site would constitute a further hazard, and that not enough is known about the long-term implications of burying radioactive material. Despite a fierce publicity campaign there is generally a feeling that central government decisions will ultimately prevail.
